summary: Email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorney and defense attorney Laura Menninger regarding discovery deficiencies in US v. Maxwell case. The correspondence focuses on technical issues with photo evidence production from CDs recovered from Epstein's residence, including mismatched hash values, corrupt files, and problems with metadata indices.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Partner at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C. representing Ghislaine Maxwell. She is raising multiple technical issues with the government's production of photo evidence and metadata.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, appears to be part of Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Copied on the email chain, appears to be part of Maxwell's defense team with email address besternheim@mac.com.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Government prosecutor from the Southern District of New York handling the US v. Maxwell case. Communicating with defense about discovery issues and consulting with FBI/vendor.

connections.description: Attorney-client relationship with Maxwell vs. prosecutor relationship, engaged in discovery disputes regarding photo evidence production.
Both appear to be part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, copied on same emails.
Both appear to be part of Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, copied on same emails.

events.title: Defense raises discovery deficiencies
events.description: Laura Menninger sends detailed email outlining multiple problems with photo evidence production, including corrupt files, missing metadata, and unreadable images.

events.title: Government provides metadata overlay
events.description: Prosecutor sends metadata overlay file for images recovered from CDs from Epstein's residence, attempting to address defense concerns.

events.title: Government explains discovery issues
events.description: Prosecutor consults with FBI and vendor, explains that duplicate files were not deduplicated, corrupt files were included, and hash values should be used for matching.

events.title: Defense rejects government explanation
events.description: Menninger responds that government's explanation is insufficient, points to specific hash mismatches, and reiterates request for proper indices.

locations: Epstein's residence (source of CDs containing photos)
Southern District of New York, 1 St. Plaza, New York, NY 10007
MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center where Maxwell was held)
keyFacts: The government produced approximately 40,567 non-nude photo files from CDs recovered from Epstein's residence, but there are discrepancies in metadata matching.
Defense identified specific hash value mismatches between overlay files and indices, including example file 'SDNY_GM_C0503260 Jeffrey VF2.psd' with different MD5 hashes.
The FBI and vendor did not deduplicate images before production to ensure defense had complete set of all files recovered from the CDs.
Defense reported thousands of photos are unreadable both by counsel and by Maxwell at MDC, impairing constitutional right to review discovery.
The correspondence reveals tension over 'highly confidential' designation for nude/partially-nude photos, with defense noting they saw nothing qualifying as child pornography.
